001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
010import java.util.Objects;
011
012public class Quaternion {
013  private final double m_r;
014  private final Vector<N3> m_v;
015
016  /** Constructs a quaternion with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
017  public Quaternion() {
018    m_r = 1.0;
019    m_v = VecBuilder.fill(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
020  }
021
022  /**
023   * Constructs a quaternion with the given components.
024   *
025   * @param w W component of the quaternion.
026   * @param x X component of the quaternion.
027   * @param y Y component of the quaternion.
028   * @param z Z component of the quaternion.
029   */
030  public Quaternion(double w, double x, double y, double z) {
031    m_r = w;
032    m_v = VecBuilder.fill(x, y, z);
033  }
034
035  /**
036   * Multiply with another quaternion.
037   *
038   * @param other The other quaternion.
039   * @return The quaternion product.
040   */
041  public Quaternion times(Quaternion other) {
042    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quaternion#Scalar_and_vector_parts
043    final var r1 = m_r;
044    final var v1 = m_v;
045    final var r2 = other.m_r;
046    final var v2 = other.m_v;
047
048    final var v1x = v1.get(0, 0);
049    final var v1y = v1.get(1, 0);
050    final var v1z = v1.get(2, 0);
051
052    final var v2x = v2.get(0, 0);
053    final var v2y = v2.get(1, 0);
054    final var v2z = v2.get(2, 0);
055
056    var cross =
057        VecBuilder.fill(v1y * v2z - v2y * v1z, v2x * v1z - v1x * v2z, v1x * v2y - v2x * v1y);
058    double dot = v1x * v2x + v1y * v2y + v1z * v2z;
059
060    final var v = v2.times(r1).plus(v1.times(r2)).plus(cross);
061    return new Quaternion(r1 * r2 - dot, v.get(0, 0), v.get(1, 0), v.get(2, 0));
062  }
063
064  @Override
065  public String toString() {
066    return String.format(
067        "Quaternion(%s, %s, %s, %s)", m_r, m_v.get(0, 0), m_v.get(1, 0), m_v.get(2, 0));
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Checks equality between this Quaternion and another object.
072   *
073   * @param obj The other object.
074   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
075   */
076  @Override
077  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
078    if (obj instanceof Quaternion) {
079      var other = (Quaternion) obj;
080
081      final var r1 = m_r;
082      final var v1 = m_v;
083      final var r2 = other.m_r;
084      final var v2 = other.m_v;
085
086      final var v1x = v1.get(0, 0);
087      final var v1y = v1.get(1, 0);
088      final var v1z = v1.get(2, 0);
089
090      final var v2x = v2.get(0, 0);
091      final var v2y = v2.get(1, 0);
092      final var v2z = v2.get(2, 0);
093
094      return Math.abs(r1 * r2 + v1x * v2x + v1y * v2y + v1z * v2z) > 1.0 - 1E-9;
095    }
096    return false;
097  }
098
099  @Override
100  public int hashCode() {
101    return Objects.hash(m_r, m_v);
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Returns the inverse of the quaternion.
106   *
107   * @return The inverse quaternion.
108   */
109  public Quaternion inverse() {
110    return new Quaternion(m_r, -m_v.get(0, 0), -m_v.get(1, 0), -m_v.get(2, 0));
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Normalizes the quaternion.
115   *
116   * @return The normalized quaternion.
117   */
118  public Quaternion normalize() {
119    double norm = Math.sqrt(getW() * getW() + getX() * getX() + getY() * getY() + getZ() * getZ());
120    if (norm == 0.0) {
121      return new Quaternion();
122    } else {
123      return new Quaternion(getW() / norm, getX() / norm, getY() / norm, getZ() / norm);
124    }
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Returns W component of the quaternion.
129   *
130   * @return W component of the quaternion.
131   */
132  public double getW() {
133    return m_r;
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Returns X component of the quaternion.
138   *
139   * @return X component of the quaternion.
140   */
141  public double getX() {
142    return m_v.get(0, 0);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Returns Y component of the quaternion.
147   *
148   * @return Y component of the quaternion.
149   */
150  public double getY() {
151    return m_v.get(1, 0);
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Returns Z component of the quaternion.
156   *
157   * @return Z component of the quaternion.
158   */
159  public double getZ() {
160    return m_v.get(2, 0);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the rotation vector representation of this quaternion.
165   *
166   * <p>This is also the log operator of SO(3).
167   *
168   * @return The rotation vector representation of this quaternion.
169   */
170  public Vector<N3> toRotationVector() {
171    // See equation (31) in "Integrating Generic Sensor Fusion Algorithms with
172    // Sound State Representation through Encapsulation of Manifolds"
173    //
174    // https://arxiv.org/pdf/1107.1119.pdf
175    double norm = m_v.normF();
176
177    if (norm < 1e-9) {
178      return m_v.times(2.0 / getW() - 2.0 / 3.0 * norm * norm / (getW() * getW() * getW()));
179    } else {
180      if (getW() < 0.0) {
181        return m_v.times(2.0 * Math.atan2(-norm, -getW()) / norm);
182      } else {
183        return m_v.times(2.0 * Math.atan2(norm, getW()) / norm);
184      }
185    }
186  }
187}
